paper_abstract: Recently the first author presented exact formulas for the number of 2(n)-periodic binary sequences with given 1-error linear complexity, and an exact formula for the expected 1-error linear complexity and upper and lower bounds for the expected k-error linear complexity, k >= 2, of a random 2(n)-periodic binary sequence. A crucial role for the analysis played the Chan-Games algorithm. We use a more sophisticated generalization of the Chan-Games algorithm by Ding et al. to obtain exact formulas for the counting function and the expected value for the 1-error linear complexity for p(n)-periodic sequences over F-p,p prime. Additionally we discuss the calculation of lower and upper bounds on the k-error linear complexity of p(n)-periodic sequences over F-p.
paper_title: Remarks on the k-error linear complexity of p(n)-periodic sequences
